Notations:
Italic, bold lower-case, and bold upper-case letters denote scalar, column vector, and matrix, respectively.
Operators (â‹…)â€ superscriptâ‹…â€ (\cdot)^{\dagger}, (â‹…)ğ–³superscriptâ‹…ğ–³(\cdot)^{\sf T}, and diagâ€‹(â‹…)diagâ‹…{\rm diag}(\cdot) denote the conjugate, transpose, and diagonal matrix, respectively.
Besides, operator |â‹…||\cdot| returns the cardinality of a set or the absolute value of a scalar, and âˆ¥â‹…âˆ¥\|\cdot\| represents the Euclidean norm, while â„œâ¡{â‹…}â‹…\Re\{\cdot\} denotes the real part of a complex value.
The important notations used throughout the paper are listed in Table I.
